p: All tested Candida species were sensitive to the essential oils and MIC values ranged from 0.625 to 1.25 Î¼L/mL ( Table 2). C. albicans and C. krusei were more sensitive to the V. guianensis oil, while C. glabrata and C. parapsilosis were more sensitive to the H. courbaril oil. All the oils showed fungicidal activity and all Candida strains were sensitive to the positive control fluconazole ( Table 2). According to MFC/MIC ratios, the effect of all oils on the Candida species can be considered fungicidal.
